alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chinle Valley; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Coconino Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Western Mogollon Rim; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued October 10 at 12:51PM MST until October 11 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM MST /11 AM MDT/ TO 6 PM MST /7 PM MDT/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. Localized stronger winds are expected primarily for areas downslope of the high terrain. * WHERE...The Kaibab and Coconino plateaus, along the Mogollon Rim, the White Mountains, the Little Colorado River Valley, and the Navajo Nation. * WHEN...From 10 AM MST /11 AM MDT/ to 6 PM MST /7 PM MDT/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects, including holiday decor. Tree limbs could snap resulting in a few power outages. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Patchy blowing dust, along Interstate 40 from Twin Arrows to the New Mexico border and area roadways in the Navajo Nation, will lead to reduced visibilities, resulting in hazardous driving conditions at times.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
